title: QOL Buff for Miss Fortune
body:
Have her Strut fully activated on respawn, because upon respawn it starts only partially charged.

It already says it will be fully charged after not being hit for 7 seconds. Why should death increase that timer?

EDIT:
The reason I suggest this is that is can become a hassle, particularly in situations where you will want her W to help defend an inhibitor. You can't afford to get there as quickly because you have to W on the platform to get the full speed and will need to reset it once you get to the minions.

EDIT 2:
Confirmed in a recent game that activating her Strut will disable the undo function, which is another reason to simply have her passive up in full upon respawn.

Except it's not "one or two autos" if they're on your nexus, nexus turrets or inhibitors. And only the nexus is close enough for you to still have the steroid if you used it on the platform.

Strut will be off cooldown by the time you leave base if you're walking from the platform to lane. As I've mentioned, it becomes a choice of which hindrance will you take during an active siege because you either lose out on the steroid or getting there sooner. If there's no siege on your base then it's not much of a buff.
so that feature already exists. it's just part of knowing how to play Mf
Except it's not. It puts the spell on cooldown, which is inconvenient if you need to rush over and save an inhibitor, because you've put your attack speed steroid on cooldown to get there faster.

or just having a brain. don't have to be an MF main to pop your W right when you spawn. not only do you get the mana back, but by the time you leave you the base itself you will already have it off cooldown.

As someone else mentioned, it prevents the undo function. It also means that you're actually hindered when trying to rush to defend something like an inhibitor late game because you have to cast it on the platform or save it for when you get to the fight. I don't feel like that's a choice that should ever need to be made.

Honestly, I supported your entire argument until that last sentence. I dislike when choices are dumbed down for players. If you have to choose between leaving fountain a slight bit faster or waiting in case you need the cooldown for a fight, I think that's something that should be left as-is. Make players choose between having utility for later or using it immediately. If Rammus wants to use his Q to leave fountain faster, he risks it being on cooldown if a teamfight breaks out - why should MF have the benefit of not having to choose?

That being said, if we just make the argument about her passive not being active on respawn, that I can agree with - if homeguards is instantly refreshed on respawn, then other movement speed passives should be as well.

You answered it with the next bit.

> That being said, if we just make the argument about her passive not being active on respawn, that I can agree with - if homeguards is instantly refreshed on respawn, then other movement speed passives should be as well.

It's a counter-intuitive choice that's forced as a result of her W passive not being readily up on respawn. Her W cooldown is low enough that it's rare for this change to be a buff, since it focuses on her ability to get off the platform and defend. The only situation where this is a buff that matters is when there is an active siege on her base (anything from the nexus to the inhibitor turrets).

The difference is that most champions actually have to USE an ability to get out of base faster. For MF, its a passive. I'm not sure, but I feel like other passive-type abilities like this are instant on respawn - Eve invisibility, Malz shield, Malphite shield, Taliyah's speed, Garen's HP regen (though its useless),

They are. MF's gets the partial activation, not the full. The rest get full activation and I suspect it's partially due to a coding issue since hers is the only one with a partial activation.

Strut's passive, without using the skill actively, has 2 parts. After a few seconds of not being hit, gains 25 movement speed. After a few more seconds, the bonus is increased even further based on the rank of Strut. 

Using the active portion immediately grants the full bonus. MF can use the active to get out faster by fully charging the passive immediately, but then can lose out on having the attack speed boost ready depending on how far she has to go. The further she has to go, the less likely it will be an issue.
Prevents undo function, may be a *slight* problem.

But because Homeguards is a % boost, and Strut is a flat boost, Homeguards gives a slightly greater effect when her passive is fully up.

In addition, how many scenarios are so desperate such a buff would make a significant difference?

Lastly, please read some of the other arguments. At a certain point of defense, it becomes a choice where both options hinder you and that's counter intuitive.

Since alot of people max W second the free 100 ms plus homeguards _can_ make alot of difference. That's a free mobi boots right off the bat with no cost.
